Dr. Joseph T. Hart served as the curator and librarian at the Gould Memorial Library on the University Heights campus.

corpname.value: New York University. School of Engineering and Science

abstract.value: Dr. Joseph T. Hart served as the curator and librarian at the Gould Memorial Library on the University Heights campus. The collection includes correspondence, newspaper clippings, publications, and reports regarding New York University and the School of Engineering and Science from 1930-1973.

physloc.value: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

Series I: General NYU Material

p.value: Series I includes Hart's statement on NYU's Program for Leadership and Service in the 1960s; correspondence related to the Hall of Fame, the Institute of Mechanical Engineers, and the Katra-Black Student Group; proposals written in 1965 related to funding the construction of a technology building at the University Heights Campus; a 1952 survey of the University Heights Library; a 1965 survey on the total data processing requirements of NYU; and pamphlets and clippings related to University Heights campus facilities and general university activities.

Series II: School of Engineering and Science

p.value: Series II includes correspondence and clippings related to the planning, construction, and opening of an engineering library at the University Heights campus between 1961 and 1965; and clippings and press releases related to general activities of and the history of the School of Engineering and Science.
Identification of item, date; Joseph Hart Papers; MC 87; box number; folder number; New York University Archives; New York University.
Processing decisions made prior to December 2018 were not recorded.

This collection is composed of materials collected by Dr. Joseph T. Hart regarding New York University and the School of Engineering and Science from 1930-1973. Materials include correspondence related to the Hall of Fame, the Institute of Medical Engineers, and the Katra-Black Student Group; newspaper clippings related to general university activities, and construction and opening of the Engineering library at the University Heights campus; pamphlets related to facilities funding and University Heights campus buildings; reports related to the total data processing requirements for NYU in 1965; proposals for facility funding; and a statement written by Hart in 1961 related to NYU's Program for Leadership and Services in the 1960s.

This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
